required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Short-Term Follow-up Indicator for Total Knee Arthroplasty and Body Mass Index
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Elevated Body Mass Index on Short-term Follow-up Indicators for Total Knee Arthroplasty : a Retrospective Study

brief_summary.textblock:
The main purpose of this study is to determine the influence of obesity on the short term follow-up indicators of a polyvalent geriatric rehabilitation clinic after total knee arthroplasty. It is a retrospective, comparative study
The secondary purposes are to explore the links between length of stay and short-term follow-up indicators of a polyvalent geriatric rehabilitation clinic after total knee arthroplasty.

primary_outcome.measure: Range Of Motion of the Knee
primary_outcome.description: The investigators will report the initial, final flexion and extension and calculate the total gain of flexion and extension of the knee for each participant.
This score is a composite score recommended by the French Authority of Health.

secondary_outcome.description: The investigators will report the length of stay in the rehabilitation clinic for each participant.

arm_group.description: Patients with a BMI inferior to the obesity limit defined by the World Health Organization.
Patients with a BMI superior to the obesity limit defined by the World Health Organization.

intervention.description: All the included patients followed a rehabilitation program in the Polyvalent Geriatric Rehabilitation Clinic after total knee arthroplasty.

study_pop.textblock: Men and Women admitted after total knee arthroplasty in Polyvalent Geriatric Rehabilitation Clinic.
